time.common:timeRepresentativenessDescription: Chang et al. (2014a) presented the first analysis of energy use and GHG emissions for China’s shale gas wells.

LCIMethodAndAllocation.deviationsFromLCIMethodApproaches: this paper uses a hybrid life cycle inventory (LCI) model: (1) evaluating the direct energy use and GHG emissions by developing a process-based life cycle inventory (P-LCI), and (2) estimating the indirect energy use and GHG emissions by using an economic inputoutput-based life cycle inventory (EIO-LCI).

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.dataSelectionAndCombinationPrinciples: There are three important national demonstration zones for shale gas exploration and development in the Sichuan basin, namely Changning-Weiyuan, Fuling and Zhaotong (Dong et al., 2014). In this paper, the first two areas are selected due to their active development activities.
dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.dataTreatmentAndExtrapolationsPrinciples: Most of the data for these two areas are self-reported by the operators, i.e., PetroChina (for Changning-Weiyaun) and Sinopec (for Fuling), for example, length of road repair & construction, the size of well pad, the size of auxiliary facilities, well depth, diesel and other materials consumed in well drilling and fracturing, etc.
